paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Val142Ile, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: TTR systemic amyloidosis with prominent heart involvement

individual_records.phenotype_details: TTR systemic amyloidosis with cardiac involvement
individual_records.evidence_sentence: We present a case of a Caucasian 65-year-old man with cardiac amyloidosis and the homozygous mutation Val142Ile (classically, Val122Ile) in the transthyretin gene.
The genetic analysis was extended to the 27-year-old son and 20-year-old daughter of the proband and, as expected, both harbor in heterozygous status the same mutation identified in the father.

functional_data.summary: The Val142Ile mutation causes an altered speed of tetramer dissociation, greater formation of amyloid fibrils, and an unstable TTR tetramer compared to wild type.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family, as the proband's children are heterozygous carriers but unaffected.
variants.population_frequency: The Val142Ile mutation is extremely rare in Caucasian patients.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence for pathogenicity based on multiple publications.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is well-known and has been previously reported in patients with TTR amyloidosis.
key_quotes: This variant is very well known as pathogenic because it has been already published several times in patients clinically affected by TTR amyloidosis.
The Val142Ile mutation is extremely rare in Caucasian patients with few cases reported of ATTRv amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant was successfully extracted.
